judge.rationale: Results include multiple emails from no-reply@accounts.google.com with subjects containing 'Security alert' (e.g., 'Security alert for 1974yangao@gmail.com', 'Critical security alert...'). Aggregation also confirms the domain. This satisfies the expectation.

The matches clearly reference Bandsintown and LANY (e.g., Soft World Tour, presale code), satisfying the expectation and providing enough context to summarize the update.
Matches include Upwork 'New job alert' emails with subjects that provide brief job info (titles), enabling a concise summary. No contradictory details; aggregation confirms all are from upwork.com.
Returned summaries are generic job/inbox rollups and not specific to the 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' thread; they lack Berkeley-/speaker-specific details and event context. Aggregation is empty.

This aligns with a monthly rollup mentioning job alert themes. Aggregation is empty but not required.

All returned items are unread and have dates after the provided received_after checkpoint (1760918400, 2025-10-20T00:00:00Z). No items precede the checkpoint, indicating minimal overlap with previously processed mail. The limited result set suggests no full re-scan. Aggregation is consistent and non-contradictory.
Matches include emails with has_attachments=true and relevant metadata (e.g., from brook@thrv.com and chan@theburntapp.com), satisfying the request for recent emails with attachments.
